website_summaries.verdict: With Wi-Fi, GPS, and an OLED display, the Nikon Coolpix AW120 is one of the better rugged compact cameras you can buy, but it's not quite an Editors' Choice.
cons: Images are on the noisy side

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera for an amazing price.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing. Dove in cozumel with it 60 ft. I also ended up taking a slip on a wet stair in heels before dinner one night and in the midst of catching myself I dropped the camera off the side of the balcony one story up! Not a scratch on the camera and I managed to save myself from injury. Fabulous photos and perfect for an on the go couple/family. Looking forward to canoe trips, camping and family fun. Definitely exceeds my expectations. I am attaching a photo that I took underwater 45 ft with the camera and another of above water.
customer_reviews.author: KrissynRyan

customer_reviews.title: FLOODED AND RUINED.
customer_reviews.text: Flooded on third use. Managed to rescue the SD card, but the camera is toast. Very disappointed, and it looks like I am out 300 bucks (past the 30 day mark).
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good rugged point and shoot.
customer_reviews.text: Mostly love this camera, works well in most conditions. However, on a recent trip up to Mauna Kea observatory the lens fogged up On the inside and ruined many of our pictures? WTH! If your in a wet environment but not actually underwater, keep in mind that you have to clear the lens of water drops before you take pictures to prevent distortions. Be sure to get some practice with the settings before you ruin that " one time only" photo. Up on Mauna Kea, our iPhones took better pics. I did really like the location tagging feature, even if the altitude readings were usually off (both at sea level, and high altitude)
customer_reviews.author: mcgawb

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camerra for about six months now, and I have to say it's great. My wife says she thinks the photo quality is sometimes poor, and it doesn't have as good a zoom as non-shock/water proof cameras, but especially for kids this is the camera to buy. My daughter (6) is a camera nut, and you can just give this to her and let her run with it. I have dropped it (with my heart in my throat) several times on purpose and no problem. The kids immediately wanted to go to the pool and swim so they could be filmed. Plus its small enough to easily fit in your pocket. (I am a guy, with practical pockets.)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hasker

customer_reviews.title: Lens scratches easily. I know
customer_reviews.text: Lens scratches easily. I know, that's not exactly mindblowing, but in this market segment where protective filters are not an option it's something which will forever haunt you. One year in and the camera's getting finicky about turning on. It turns itself on in my laptop bag, draining the battery, and to add insult to injury it will sometimes refuse to turn on for hours at a time, even with a fully charged battery. My previous snorkeling camera, the very similar Canon D20, died a "groaning" death of apparent lens failure, but this one is just odd.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love. love and love this camera. Bought specifically for the 2014 Chirstmas ski trip, it worked out perfectly. Didn't have to charge the battery for the entire week of skiing, took beautiful pictures and super easy to operate. Didn't even feel it inside the ski jacket... It practically replaced my GoPro that I usually use to take pictures (not video while skiing), the GoPro battery lasts the day in the cold temperature if only taking pictures, but won't last if taking video as well. Look forward to use it more during Summer vacation at the beach, etc.
customer_reviews.author: P. Le

customer_reviews.title: I got one good vacation to Mexico documented with this camera
customer_reviews.text: I got one good vacation to Mexico documented with this camera. It took great pics and good quality videos in and out of the water. My second vacation two years later, I was only able to take pictures the first day and after that the lens and LED display were so fogged up, it was useless the rest of the trip. My third vacation the battery and charging function decided to malfunction, rendering the camera useless once again. Just ordered a new battery and charger, but I don't trust it underwater anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Mashizz

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the waterproof feature
customer_reviews.text: This camera was great for a while. The photos and video quality were good as well as how fast it could snap photos. The different picture modes were also very useful. Unfortunately all of this means nothing if you are planning to use it in the water. How does a waterproof camera suffer water damage? I couldn't believe when I saw it but water somehow made it inside the camera (the battery compartment was completely sealed) and messed up the LCD screen. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, but be sure to order the float strap!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera! I bought one of these (elsewhere, as at the time I found it cheaper) and took it on a trip to a water park.. this thing is GREAT! Very easy to use - we had it under water both in a pool and in the ocean for hours at a time without issues, and without putting a single scratch on it.. its amazing how tough this thing is! They do sell an optional silicone jacket for it as well, as well as a float strap... The float strap does NOT come with the camera, so you may want to order it separately.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: The Wi-Fi feature to connect to a smartphone works great. The neck strap I wish was a clip ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera is very solid. The Wi-Fi feature to connect to a smartphone works great. The neck strap I wish was a clip type and not a loop tie on like the wrist handles. However, I placed some small rings through the metal strap holes and used a clip type of strap. I purchased this for the rugged & waterproof design for the beach and to mount on my motorcycle. This doesn't have the optical range as more sophisticated point & shoot cameras like the Coolpix 9900, but that isn't what this type is for. That being said, it takes great pictures within it's range. I'll update once I test this underwater on vacation in May.
customer_reviews.author: Traz

customer_reviews.title: Easy solution though
customer_reviews.text: Still 5-stars but really the android app is only so-so. Connecting is problematic and plugging the camera into the computer it isn't always recognized correctly and when it does transfers are slow. Easy solution though, pull the card, use a reader, and xfers are solid and fast. The most important part is it takes great pictures and has stood up to several trips to 30ft while diving and a number of backpacking trips.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great small camera
customer_reviews.text: True waterproof (Used it in pool and sea). Honest zoom lens: just 5X but stays in focus at max. focal lens. Of course can't be compared with a pro SRL I would buy it again in case of lost.
customer_reviews.author: Perez Andres

customer_reviews.title: Image quality was OK but worse than I expected so I returned it The waterproof ...
customer_reviews.text: Image quality was OK but worse than I expected so I returned it The waterproof feature does work. The battery life for a day was good; you can use any micro USB charger so if you carry a generic USB battery pack (for phones, etc) then you don't have to worry about running out of power if you're away from a power outlet. I never had to use a battery pack to charge the camera, though.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great bullit proof camera
customer_reviews.text: Camera does everything Nikon claims. I do agree with other reviews that the picture quality is slightly "off" when in low light situations. Video quality is very good. I had no problems connecting via WiFi to my iPhone. I have the AW100 and was very satisfied with it. The AW120 is a great upgrade - especially like the WiFi & GPS features. I like the AW cameras because they are built tough and can take being caught in the rain or the accidental drop. I now have 5 Nikon DSLR & Point & Shoots - never any problems.
customer_reviews.author: S. Landry

customer_reviews.title: I am so pleased I did
customer_reviews.text: I finally coughed up the money for a Nikon for my ocean underwater adventures of swimming with sharks, stingrays etc. I am so pleased I did. It performed as I thought a Nikon should. Also, I did not have to be extra careful with my camera around the pool and at the beach. I also expected it to produce great shots on land and was not disappointed. There was some lag time between shots (therefore 4 instead of 5 stars) but I became accustomed to the wait eventually. The easily learned ability to edit shots in the camera was also a plus. I am thoroughly pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NSimmons

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera! I took it to Hawaii and snorkled everyday. The pictures are clear and crisp and the video is awesome. One of my co-workers argued with me that I didn't take the photos on my screensaver, he swore they were downloaded. They were... FROM MY CAMERA!!! I loved it so much I just bought 4 more to give away as incentives for my sales staff. Great, great value for the durability. I smacked it around climbing in and out of the dive boat, dropped it and gerenally abused the poor little thing... took it all and kept on working.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: and was good for days
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot, and was looking for a "bang er up" camera that was small enough to fit in my pocket, could hang with a little rough handling, and was good for days, nights ,and water. I was asking a lot, 200$ is not cheap, but not too pricey either. My pros are that it can do all that, but the cons are: Picture quality nights are often blurry, and that playing with the color spectrum is a continuous event per time of day, not hard to navigate around though. My girlfriend says it's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: bryan greene

customer_reviews.title: Love it but doesn't play entirely nice with Eye-Fi and iOS app is barely useful. Come on Nikon, make this the best P&S ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It's kinda the perfect point and shoot for travel. There's just one strange thing in the firmware they really should fix. If an Eye-Fi card is inserted and the settings are set to use the Eye-Fi you can't use the "Connect to Device." That makes perfect sense. but if you disable the Eye-Fi, you still can't "Connect to Device." In other words, The Eye-Fi when disabled should act like a regular card but it doesn't. Come on Nikon--update your firmware. Also update your lame iOS app. Looks at Samsung's for pointers.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Barrick

customer_reviews.title: There is a very annoying "feature" that has been added since the aw100
customer_reviews.text: There is a very annoying "feature" that has been added since the aw100, that makes the easy auto mode virtually useless for quick macro photography. Often I will focus on a flower in easy auto mode, the camera will initially pick macro, will give a great focus, then will suddenly decide I want "nighttime" and will go to a blurry focus, I have yet to find a way to get around this electronic stupidity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent camera. I have this and the red model
customer_reviews.text: excellent camera. I have this and the red model. It's a little on the heavy side but i can confirm it is waterproof. Dunked it in the ocean in Honolulu and took some shots. It's also pretty heavy duty. You can drop it (but i wouldnt recommmend doing that) and it will bounce and still work, even without a case. Taking photos with this camera is easier and faster than using the camera on my cellphone
customer_reviews.author: biscayne1

customer_reviews.title: Great Underwater Camera
customer_reviews.text: Loved this little camera while it lasted, no error on Nikon's part, do not go deeper than recommended. Camera took overall nice photos in and out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Class A

customer_reviews.title: Nikon got it right!
customer_reviews.text: A very tough camera! It doesn't take the best pictures of any point-and-shoot, but it makes up for this by being rugged. Having said that, I will also say that the picture quality is NOT bad either. It's small enough to be inconspicuous and easy to carry but powerful enough to capture some good shots. The ability to remotely control this camera and take pics and video underwater is awesome and shouldn't be overlooked. If you're an outdoors kinda person then this would be a great camera for you.
customer_reviews.author: Il Diavolo

customer_reviews.title: BEST CAMERA I'VE EVER HAD- SO WORTH THE MONEY!!
customer_reviews.text: SO WORTH THE MONEY. I was debating over the go pro and this one. I fell in love with this camera. The super vivid option made my pictures in Maui look absolutely unreal. The underwater video at 75 feet is perfect! i took 4 hours of video and thousands of pictures...worth every penny. We all looked gorgeous in the pictures and the scenery looks incredible compared to our other cameras. I'm in love with this camera. BEST PURCHASE EVER. Even all of my friends were like "wow, its worth every penny"
customer_reviews.author: Lisabelle

customer_reviews.title: Great underwater experience
customer_reviews.text: This was well worth the money. We have a pool at home and were looking for a underwater camera. This camera takes excellent underwater photos and video. My kids use it and are not gentle. I've seen this dropped several times. We even made a hokey underwater movie. My only complaint is that it can't teach my kids to turn it off when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: walzla

customer_reviews.title: This is a REFURBISHED unit!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a REFURBISHED unit!!! This is not indicated anywhere in the product description. Buyer beware. The unit I received had a torn battery compartment seal, corrosion on one of the connectors, something that looked like sand in the battery compartment and did not include a charging cable. I will be returning this. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ragnor

customer_reviews.title: Glad I chose this underwater camera!!
customer_reviews.text: Camera takes great pics for your average point and shoot novice photographer like myself. Pictures are very sharp and colors are right on. Offer basic functions on auto and many settings and options when set manually. I wanted a camera I could take ro the Caribbean with me to take some underwater shots. I was very leary at first but about submerging it but once I did I was extremely pleased with both the pictures i took as well as the high def videos. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey O'Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera for Active Outdoor Use
customer_reviews.text: I've bought about a dozen of these cameras for use by field crews in my company. Very good photos. I especially like the GPS performance, whichnis fast to acquire satellites. From what Imhave read, GPS is a problem for most other cameras in this category. An excellent, tough, and compact camera built to survive rugged conditions. Perfect for many applications. Plus it does video and more if needed, somewhat of a higher end GoPro.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Grizzle

customer_reviews.title: in order to take advantage if the smart nature to transfer pictures and video to another smart ...
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate as to what you see and what you get. Two things I would mention, in order to take advantage if the smart nature to transfer pictures and video to another smart device, the OTHER device must have the proper Nikon app downloaded. So be sure to prepare that ahead of time. Also, the GPS data that appears on the pictures when viewing on the camera must be stamped on before you transfer it off if you wish it to still be there. Overall very satisfied with the performance of the device, takes beautiful nature and landscape shots.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: THIS ONE WAS RECOMMENDED TO ME BY A FRIEND WHO
customer_reviews.text: THIS ONE WAS RECOMMENDED TO ME BY A FRIEND WHO, IN HIS DAILY BUSINESS TAKES A HUGE AMOUNT OF PICTURES. FROM MY LIMITED AMOUNT OF PICTURE TAKING WITH THIS CAMERA, ALONG WITH THE HIGH SPEED SD CARD IT ALLOWS ME TO TAKE PICTURES VERY FAST AND THE ZOOM FEATURE WORKS GREAT. SOME MENTION WAS MADE IN ONE OF THE REVIEWS ABOUT THE PICTURES BLURRING. I HAVE NOT FOUND THAT TO BE THE CASE.
customer_reviews.author: DOC L.

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera... I work with special needs children and adults and often times cameras get dropped or wet. This is pretty much child-proof. It takes amazing pictures as well. When compared to my Nikon D5100 the pictures are very similar. The only thing I don't like about this one is the lens is not protected when the camera is off. This necessitates having a separate case for it (not just being able to throw it in a purse).
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our anniversary trip to Colorado, it worked great. I even used it White Water Rafting, in which I ended up in the water and had absolutely no issue. I only charged it once in an entire week. Though I wish I could figure out how to reduce the amount of time the preview is shown, it can be a pain when trying to snap multiple pictures quickly (though you can click the menu button and it makes it go away I just wish it was automatic).
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Dhuse

customer_reviews.title: I must be doing something wrong, it's a Nikon!
customer_reviews.text: The screen didn't work underwater so I had to guess at what I was taking pictures of. Also had to manually turn off flash before every picture I wanted to take in a "no flash" environment. It's a Nikon so I have to assume it's user error, right?
customer_reviews.author: Dana H.

customer_reviews.title: Snapping Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I received this camera when it was scheduled and in perfect condition. I have shot many photos with it but have not yet had it under the water. This is coming soon. I can admit that the placement of the lens has been somewhat of a learning curve for me as I have several photos with "fingers included". But now not so much. The qualities of the camera are limited only by the skills of the photographer. I am more than happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie L.

customer_reviews.title: Good pics and video. Perfect travel camera.
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed. It has way more features than I need, but I think the longer I use it the more I will use them. Takes great pictures within the automatic setting modes. The pictures that weren't so great were more user error and infamiliarity with settings than camera performance - I beleive I was asking it to do too much in auto mode. Took some underwater video which turned out nice (1080 HD). Couldn't be more pleased with this camera. I don't hand out 5 stars readily and this camera is closer to a 5 than a 4.5. Bought this to replace a Panasonic Lumix, which never took good pictures and had issues with "orbs" when using the flash.
customer_reviews.author: RDKnight

customer_reviews.title: Solid economical choice for amateur use
customer_reviews.text: Was overall pleased with the AW120's performance during a recent trip to the Virgin Islands. Quality of images are definitely dependent on water clarity and distance from target - but found I was able to snap a few nice ones (have attached an example). Video was satisfactory enough to show friends sea turtles coming up for air, or corals waving in the current. Did not find the manual controls as intuitive as I might have liked - but I'm sure it will work out once I dedicate some time to it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. David Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little camera
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little camera. I'm writing this review after only having done minimal testing. I'm a bit of a camera geek. The controls are a bit clunky for doing more sophisticated stuff, but I bought it expecting it to be optimized as a point & shoot, and that's what it is / does. The only caveat so far is that it comes in an excessively "dummy" mode that doesn't let you do anything, and it takes a bit of poking to find your way out of that mode.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic underwater pics
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic underwater pics. Got this for my husband for our honeymoon to Hawaii and he LOVED taking pics from our scuba trip. Only regret - we didn't get a bigger memory card and we filled it up pretty quickly with videos - check settings before you start snapping away! Great picks both underwater and on land. I'd done a lot of research into waterproof cameras before purchasing and definitely not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gen

customer_reviews.title: not what I had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I really like how quickly the camera "boots" up and how quickly one can snap multiple photos. The wide angle does not appear to be quite as wide as other cameras with similar lens spec. Battery life is excellent. I was expecting to be able to actually use the WiFi with windows and to have some transfer capability to a PC. That was not the case and the WiFi is worthless unless you want to use android or iPad with an app.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: So far so good !! Screen it's good! Videos and pictures too!
customer_reviews.text: I've used it to do snorkeling in Costa Rica and has worked just as I expected. Screen it's actually pretty good. Some people mentioned it was difficult to see in clarity. Well, not at all! I could see perfectly on the screen. Pictures are also really fast and good quality! It's a good purchase! Highly recommended! Just make sure you follow every guideline to take care of it!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Daniel González Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Great condition, horrible battery.
customer_reviews.text: Camera arrived in great condition, but the battery lasted for 3 hours and would not recharge anymore. I had to buy replacement batteries after only one use. A little disappointed and need to see how long the actual camera will last.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge Nikon fan so this automatically gets at least 4 stars. It's got just about everything going in it's favor with one significant downfall for those who are accustomed to shooting with a Nikon DSLR which is image quality. While it's not terrible and the video quality is surprisingly excellent, the pixel quality is a bit disappointing when you regularly shoot with a dslr. Most people will not even notice, but shooting with a D800 and switching to this is a huge difference and I think I'll just take along my dslr anyway for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jordanv

customer_reviews.title: Great pics!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for snorkeling at the GBR - did a great job. Used about 10 times over a month long period in Australia and Tahiti. I'm very happy with the picture quality. I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great camera! I purchased after taking a Surf Class ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! I purchased after taking a Surf Class in Costa Rica. One of the people in my class had this camera. He sent me the photos he had taken. I loved all the pictures but the action shots were amazing. And it was around his neck the whole time we were all in the water. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this camera! It worked wonderfully underwater and everywhere else. I would highly recommend it whether you are vacationing or just taking pictures and videos with family & friends. I am a Realtor and I take all of my own photographs of my listings as well as photographs for other Realtors. I am going to take this camera for its first ever "photo shoot" of a home this week. If it works well, it will become my "go to" camera for work, as well. Thank you, Nikon!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great travel camera
customer_reviews.text: This great travel camera can be controlled with a smartphone and upload directly to Eye-Fi. It appears nearly indestructible, and the fully digital zoom (no motor to break) works as well or better than my S8000. As an upgrade for my P60, this is a great travel camera, with functions nearly as good as a real DSLR at a slight fraction of the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Danny

customer_reviews.title: It's great to take to the pool and shoot pictures (and ...
customer_reviews.text: Took this camera on vacation the weekend that I bought it. It's great to take to the pool and shoot pictures (and videos) of the kids in and under the water. The picture quality is fantastic! I am please with the zoom range given the set up of the camera. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K. Railey

customer_reviews.title: great camera. i took this camera to a FL ...
customer_reviews.text: great camera. i took this camera to a FL trip rode with dolphins, snorkel, swam with fishes, did video under the water, in the pool in the ocean with no problem. it took really clear pictures, even when in zoomed and under the water. i was very pleased. no issue on water getting in the battery part. and when you open the door compartment where the battery is, then turn on the camera it has a cool feature just to let you know that the door was open and to double check before heading into the waters.
customer_reviews.author: Tabby

customer_reviews.title: Solid Camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for a rafting trip through the Grand Canyon. So, I have not used if for diving, just a camera that I would not be afraid to get wet--a lot. It is easy to use and took great pictures. I banged it around quite a bit and it worked flawlessly. The thing I did not like is that the battery depletes with little to no warning. The gauge shows 2/3 power and then click, it says 'Battery Exhausted'. That having been said--it took a lot of pictures before that happened. But, buy an extra battery and keep it with you. (I was glad I had three batteries for the week).
customer_reviews.author: EITS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera, pretty pictures, great photos and videos by snorkeling
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera, pretty pictures, great photos and videos by snorkeling. Very useful wifi connection to download photos on other devices with Nikon App. No problem of condensation on the lens as with my another aquatic Olympus camera. I have not had leaks though I've only done snorkeling less than 1 m deep. Cons: It is very difficult to see the image or images on the screen in direct sunlight on the beach. The battery lasts less than in my other camera: 1/4 battery no longer works. I recommend buying an extra battery
customer_reviews.author: rigotordoc

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera has been on 2 trips with me to date, to the beach and into the water and on a white water rafting trip. The pictures are beautiful and it withstood all abuse without a scratch. I was extremely impressed with the speed; I was able to take pictures of people jumping off a cliff into the water without burred images. The video performed just as well. I plan to include this camera whenever I travel.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Takes a beating and still ticking. Scuba dive down to 64ft and still worked perfect. Great color. I also really liked the wireless part. Transferred all the pics to my ipad with no problem and no internet.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Opdahl

customer_reviews.title: They all came out beautiful! It was nice to have a small camera ...
customer_reviews.text: Just took this camera on a trip to Disney and took pictures and videos in the park and in the lazy river at our resort pool. They all came out beautiful! It was nice to have a small camera that I did not have to worry about getting wet if it rained while in the park, and the water shots are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: LoveMama02

customer_reviews.title: This camara is just awesome! For the price and versatility of it makes ...
customer_reviews.text: This camara is just awesome! For the price and versatility of it makes it unique. Great quality of pictures and so handy that I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mau! -

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on our trip to Fiji
customer_reviews.text: The camera is durable enough that you don't worry at all about it. Works well under water, takes great pictures, and has a great price. Only downside is it needs a wrist strap (it only comes with a around the neck strap, which isn't terribly useful underwater.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Good picture quality in a sturdy compact camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is compact and very sturdy. That is exactly what I was looking for. I would have liked the option for RAW-pictures but that is obviously something that is not available for this kind of cameras. I had a Canon D-10 and that one could work with RAW after applying a hack. The successor of this camera has not the same image quality as the Nikon Coolpix AW120 so I decided for the latter. I don't regret it. I mad close to 350 pictures in the past two week and in only one picture I missed the flexibility of RAW.
customer_reviews.author: Johannes G. M. Dohmen

customer_reviews.title: Not too happy with the picture quality and the battery indicator
customer_reviews.text: Fog formed on lens and screen after 2 days of use in water. I cleaned and did whatever the instructions said. Not too happy with the picture quality and the battery indicator. I ended up returning it... Will be looking into the Olympus brand pretty soon....
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: I love it, it's the best camera I ever had!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera, and I carry it with me everywhere I go. I have dropped many times and it keeps working. I have taken it under water many times and it works great! I prefer it the professional camera I also own because it's a good combination between size and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Colombo

customer_reviews.title: Well made and good color rendition..
customer_reviews.text: A nice and well made camera with a full set of features. I like that build quality and feel my wife can be a little more rough with it since it doesn't have a lens that extends beyond the camera. I would recommend this as a travel camera and like the color saturation of Nikon sensors.
customer_reviews.author: ASaenz

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Easily takes awesome shots and videos. My 6 year old grandson has a great time using it in their pool. Was perfect for beach trips with the grandkids. Very durable but that means it is a little heavier than most point and shoot cameras. Most of the "floating wrist straps" do not keep it from sinking.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Mueller

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, only 10m deep in the sea
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, only 10m deep in the sea. Easy to snap quality pics with 15min of learning and a very steady hand/base. Low light pics are very poor as expected with a small aperture.
customer_reviews.author: US home buyer

customer_reviews.title: The best underwater camera I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for our trip to Bora Bora. This camera is amazing underwater! Ideal for snorkels because of its light weight and stability. It takes great videos too! Battery lasts a long time and charges very quickly. I highly recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Ariosa

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this camera. We bought the camera primarily to use in our pool for underwater fun. It performed so well we have started bringing it with us to events with the kids instead of dragging around our nikon dslr. Very pleased with the performance...we bought a second for my parents.
customer_reviews.author: M. St Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, nice pictures
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, nice pictures, I went to Cancun to scuba diving no more than 25 feet didn't have any problem and it is easy to use, You can also take pictures from your smartphone, I am not a big fan of underwater things but this camera does the job well, It was nice taking pictures under heavy rains, the quality of the pictures and videos are great for me, I tried under swimming pool too and it works better without flash sometimes. My camera got some scratches in the front part :( a cover protector is a good idea specially if plan to travel.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael G.

customer_reviews.title: ... that had all the features and this does not disappoint. Better battery life and FAR more features than ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a proper replacement for a GoPro that had all the features and this does not disappoint. Better battery life and FAR more features than the GoPro has and all the toughness.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Have not tried the camera under water yet but so far the pictures are beautiful. (I am not a professional photographer though) Edit: Love the camera I take it on all my trips and have taken pictures in and out of water in the ocean, lake and the pool. If you go somewhere deep make sure to have a floating device attached because the camera sinks.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera. No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Takes awesome pics underwater and above. Light weight and fits in your pocket. Love the app on my phone so I can view and upload pics from phone. Also allows remote shutter control. Love it
customer_reviews.author: DNAMEA

customer_reviews.title: great, clear photos
customer_reviews.text: Wi-Fi connection is not very reliable, and to charge, the battery compartment must be opened. Also, have not yet figured out how to select flash "on", only auto or off. All in all, great, clear photos, and of course, water and shock proof, which is necessary. Would recommend purchasing the wrist strap, to have another option besides the shoulder/neck strap.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: It took great pics all the time and underwater was great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a Hawaii trip. Was used for two weeks both in and out of the water. It took great pics all the time and underwater was great. Video turned out awesome. I'm sure if you paid quite a bit more you could get a better underwater camera but for the price this one cannot be beat. I would definitely recommend. Only bad thing is that the battery doesn't seem to last that long but it does charge very fast.
customer_reviews.author: R. Leeth

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera, but no manual and bad software.
customer_reviews.text: The camera is right sized and hopefully durable. But, it came without a complete manual - you have to download it online. To use the wifi with my IPad, I had to watch a YouTube video because the instructions were simply stupid.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Billmore

customer_reviews.title: All around good
customer_reviews.text: Very please with the ease of use. The pictures a quite good especially indoors at night. Underwater pictures and movies while snorkeling and whale watching were as good as being there.
customer_reviews.author: 400ss

customer_reviews.title: Camera now useless. Have seen no other like complaints
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Nikon Coolpix AW 120, mid-June 2014, from Amazon. Charged battery an took several pics (all dry land). Safely stored camera and took it out to use August 2014. Charged battery. Unable to lock battery-chamber/memory card slot cover; latch inoperable. Camera now useless. Have seen no other like complaints, but there you have it. Amazon offering full refund.
customer_reviews.author: laf

customer_reviews.title: Awe
customer_reviews.text: Takes great pictures. The built in editing feature is great. The zoom still produces clear pictures and panoramic covers just enough of the horizon so you're not longing for a D-SLR lens. The underwater shots look great, and the videos have come out really good. The sealing lock is simpler than my previous underwater camera.
customer_reviews.author: PVF

customer_reviews.title: amazing little waterproof camera
customer_reviews.text: amazing little waterproof camera. really nice for not hace to worry in pool and beach. newer model W300 is 4K 30p and 1080 60p amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't pair with phone but great pics
customer_reviews.text: Camera takes great pictures but I have only been successful in pairing it with my phone one time. I bought this just for a trip I took and used it while snorkeling and got some great pictures but now I cannot get it to pair up again with my phone and I'm really bummed!
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pictures and video
customer_reviews.text: Like all my other Nikon products, this camera worked perfectly. I used it snorkeling in St John and on a recent rafting trip. Ended up also buying a Float Strap, just in case someone dropped it in the water.
customer_reviews.author: D. Broms

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a photographer so I wanted something easy to use. This was a great choice! Point and click! I took this camera with me on a cruise recently, the underwater shots while snorkeling in Mexico turned out great. I bought a 32G SD card as well, 600 pictures and 3 videos with room to spare!
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Nikon fan for years. This pocket camera is a bit heavier than many, but not cumbersome.Not bulky. It is hefty and durable. I love the underwater feature. I used it while snorkeling for two hours. Amazing pictures. Camera works great in water and great in all other situations. User-friendly. Fantastic capabilities. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect camera for the clumsy or adventurous!
customer_reviews.text: I have dropped this thing in the frigid waters of the Pacific ocean off the coast of Chile. Shot underwater video in an Icelandic hot spring. Tossed it carelessly around my basement. No issues. Still takes great videos and photos. I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: S. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: but it's nice not to worry about getting it wet on a ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for in a point-and-shoot camera. I have not tried it as an underwater camera, but it's nice not to worry about getting it wet on a boat. On rare occasions focus in video mode will screw up. This seems to be related to starting video focussed on something close up (possibly getting set in macro mode), then quickly moving to something far away. Stopping and starting the video clears the problem, though.
customer_reviews.author: David Leftwich

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera for the price !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The camera is pretty fast, the effects you can apply to the photos are good, the pictures quality are better than my old Canon power shot in the average. The weak point is the continuous mode, I didn't like it the way it works.
customer_reviews.author: Ríad Mattos Nassiffe

customer_reviews.title: Play with it alot
customer_reviews.text: Compact and fairly lightweight. For hiking in foul weather you don't have to put this away. Takes great close-ups and has many different scene modes. The manual is vague about more advanced operations, but battery life is very good. Play with it. Alot.
customer_reviews.author: Paul or Kim Collins

customer_reviews.title: Love This Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Takes great pictures that you can edit to perfection, including underwater. Even without reading the 270 page manual, it is intuitively designed and I am extremely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Denisa

customer_reviews.title: very good all around camera
customer_reviews.text: very good all around camera. Wi-fi sync is below expectations but its easy to pull the memory card and load them. Has survived some drops and rough treatment without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing camera. We took it with us to Mexico ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing camera. We took it with us to Mexico after buying it at the last minute, and knowing that we were going to do some snorkeling. It takes fantastic still shots and videos underwater, and the night shots with the delayed flash, are just perfect! It's very lightweight, and the accessories kit that we got in addition, were perfect also. The large screen was great to be able to look at pictures even in the bright sunlight, and we took about 250 pictures and videos before the battery needed to be recharged! Highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Specht

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Its my 3rd upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Its my 3rd upgrade. I use a AW100 for durability at work, AW110 for my personal for watersports etc., and bought my wife the AW120. She also loves it. Works great underwater, durable, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: It Nikon was convenient and durable on my trip to Ireland. The camera also was the perfect size for my hand. However, pictures from my iPhone 5s were somewhat better quality.
customer_reviews.author: JM in Miami

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot so far
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot so far, nice pictures and does what I want it to do. Actually wasn't sure about the color, but it was better then I thought. Good buy, I went to the Store in town and I saved about $ 100 purchasing it here. The kit that goes with it is great also, but the picture of the kit said 32 GB memory card and came with a 16 GB. The camera itself came without a memory card, which if I didn't buy the kit, I wouldn't have been able to use the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix AW120 - Good but that great
customer_reviews.text: This camera looks pretty cool. I bought it about 3 weeks ago. The response time for the shutter is slow. The most dislike feature of the camera is the battery charging system. You have to open the slot and be afraid the lint can go in so that the waterproof feature will not work. Can Nikon thinks of a better way for charging the battery? Not test the waterproof part yet.
customer_reviews.author: Frank BW-NJ

customer_reviews.title: nikon always exceed expectations. but.... ...
customer_reviews.text: nikon always exceed expectations. but.... the only neg is the cumbersome wi fi connection. it is more complicated than other modern devices and sadly i resorted to the cable again, as I had an earlier version of this camera. TO nikon.... just emulate others that while it is ok allow you to require a password before sharing (unless a trusted device), it streams to a device. If they correct this, this will be a serious challenge to all others in including go pro.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Proof
customer_reviews.text: Nothing Proof: The camera worked great for 6 months EXCEPT for night shots. Third trip with the camera and the "waterproof" camera had water damage. Absolutely useless now and was not covered under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Do it! This is the camera you want.
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It's solid, take great pictures and is a great size. The features are pretty straightforward. I've never had a problem with the waterproofing like I did with my olympus stylus Tough cameras. I'd definitely recommend this camera to anyone who needs a "rugged" camera.
customer_reviews.author: C. Yang

customer_reviews.title: It's okay.
customer_reviews.text: Takes good underwater pics but just okay pictures indoors. Has some neat features to adjust the photo after a picture is taken but still just an okay camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jilly B

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: Used this camera for the first time after purchasing it and as soon as it went underwater the camera broke and no longer works. It says it's supposed to be waterproof and that is definitely not the case. Very disappointed and upset! My new expensive camera doesn't work and I didn't even get to use it once!
customer_reviews.author: Breanne Evans

customer_reviews.title: could be better
customer_reviews.text: Everything pretty good except the charging port access. Will be much better with external charging port with rubber seal, instead of opening the whole battery and memory card compartment. Pictures came out rich color but not as sharp. A good secondary camera for water activities.
customer_reviews.author: iPhonetic

customer_reviews.title: Buy it today...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing !!! I take photos in the field for my job and the resolution is great. Then I geotag the photos and Google Earth puts each photo where I was standing when I took it.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Sherrill, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and great pictures a year after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great camera and great pictures a year after purchase. Clear shots underwater and dry land of scenery. Making sure to rinse with tapwater before opening compartment is a must for us now. Bought the floating strap and it works great together
customer_reviews.author: skidder

customer_reviews.title: Pretty frustrating. It was then stolen so I couldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: It broke after just a couple uses. Pretty frustrating. It was then stolen so I couldn't even use the warranty to get it fixed. I did love it when it worked tho.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera for multi use !
customer_reviews.text: So far camera works great , good quality and zooms well . Arrived fast in Nikon packaged box. We haven’t tested it under water yet but we are going snorkeling soon and will! Just what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Horak

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. Wish I could play with aperture and shutter speed, but it's great for surviving going thru slot canyons in SE Utah. Only time it's annoyed me is with macro photos in that the light it shines for autofocus whites out the subject, so it can't focus.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lemming

customer_reviews.title: Great underwater camera, 59 feet depth rating and sharp images with good light.
customer_reviews.text: Great underwater camera with good images with existing light. However, flash photos are not as good as standard point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Lee

product_meta.title: Nikon COOLPIX AW120 16.1 MP Wi-Fi and Waterproof Digital Camera with GPS and Full HD 1080p Video (Black) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackFROM THE MANUFACTURER


THE CAMERA FOR THOSE WHO GO BIG.
 To capture thrilling first-person views of your epic moments, to really share the rush with your friends and family, you need a camera that's rugged, sure—but you also need a camera that takes outstanding photos and videos. The waterproof, freezeproof and shockproof COOLPIX AW120 delivers the image quality your big moments deserve. Strap it to your chest with the optional Chest Harness and record mind-blowing Full HD 1080p videos with stereo sound, smooth slow motion sequences and high-res photos, even in challenging conditions. When things get bumpy, Nikon's new Hybrid VR system helps keep your shots sharp and steady. The camera's superb wide-angle (24mm equivalent) f/2.8 NIKKOR glass lens gets more in the frame and captures bright, sharp images that will have you reliving the action on your "off" days. You don't even have to wait to share the rush—with built-in Wi-Fi, your COOLPIX AW120 shots can instantly appear on a compatible smartphone or tablet for easy sharing. Your friends will be jealous they weren't there!



READY FOR EXTREME ADVENTURES
WATERPROOF, SHOCKPROOF AND FREEZEPROOF
The COOLPIX AW120 can handle all that Mother Nature can throw at it. Take it diving to depths of up to 59-feet. Shoot at temperatures as cold as 14° F. And don't sweat drops of up to 6.6 feet. Whether it's in your hand, mounted to a surfboard, clipped on a backpack or attached to a scuba tank, every twist, splash, dive and crash can be recorded in both still and Full HD 1080p movies. Plus, Nikon's Action Control brings fast and easy operation to gloved hands. The COOLPIX AW120 lets you capture every thrilling moment from inside the action—not the sidelines.

YOUR SMARTPHONE'S NEW BEST FRIEND
BUILT-IN WI-FI FOR INSTANT PHOTO SHARING AND REMOTE CAMERA CONTROL WITH A COMPATIBLE SMARTPHONE OR TABLET
Your smartphone or tablet will be your favorite accessory! Take beautiful photos with the COOLPIX AW120 and watch them instantly appear on your compatible smartphone or tablet. Then share them without missing a beat—text them, email them, upload to your favorite social networking site—it’s your choice! You can even use your smartphone or tablet as a remote control for the COOLPIX AW120, perfect for self portraits and group shots that actually include you. 

SEE WHERE YOU'VE BEEN
BUILT-IN GPS, MAPPING, ELECTRONIC COMPASS AND POINTS OF INTEREST (POI) FOR CREATING AMAZING PHOTO JOURNALS
Relive the excitement of your travels in a whole new way. The COOLPIX AW120 records the exact location of each shot you take, so you can follow the path of your adventure and every stunning view along the way! Share your journeys on Google Maps, Google+, and other social networking sites, or with the included Nikon View NX2 software. Built-in mapping and Electronic compass also help you navigate unfamiliar destinations, and Points of Interest (POI) show you nearby photo-ops like scenic lookouts and historic landmarks. The COOLPIX AW120 is the ultimate travel companion!

RECORD SUPERIOR VIDEOS
FULL HD 1080P VIDEOS WITH STEREO SOUND FOR DAZZLING MOVIES
If you want a compact camera that shoots stunning Full HD videos, the COOLPIX AW120 delivers. Full HD 1080p means exceptional video quality. Record the action, then connect to an HDTV* and watch your videos come alive. A built-in mic records high-quality audio in stereo. Your videos will look and sound phenomenal.
*Requires optional cable 











SUPPLIED ACCESSORIES
 * AN-CP23 Strap
 * UC-E21 USB Cable
 * EN-EL12 Rechargeable Battery
 * Charging AC Adapter EH-71P
 * BU-2

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars425 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
